snippet: Faced with three major storms in three weeks that have pushed snowfall for this season to 78.5 inches in Boston, removing the snow has become a test of endurance, ingenuity and will across New England.
abstract: Boston area faces significant logistical challenge removing snow from three successive winter storms that have pushed seasonal snowfall to 78.5 inches; storms have broken snowfall records for 14-day and 30-day periods and have confronted New Englanders with a significant test of endurance, ingenuity and will.
lead_paragraph: Faced with three major storms in three weeks that have pushed snowfall for this season to 78.5 inches in Boston, removing the snow has become a test of endurance, ingenuity and will across New England.

headline.main: Numbed by Snow, Boston Area Shudders at the Thought of More
headline.print_headline: Numbed by Snow, Boston Area Shudders at the Thought of More
